intro: Scorzonera decumbens, commonly known as the creeping scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and daisy-like appearance. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are basal, hairy, and often lobed, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Scorzonera decumbens is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
